New Jersey Institute of Technology: New Jersey Institute of Technology (NJIT) is a  public research university in  Newark, New Jersey, with a graduate-degree-granting satellite campus in Jersey City.[12] [13] Founded in 1881 with the support of local industrialists and inventors especially Edward Weston,[14]  NJIT opened as Newark Technical School (NTS) in 1885 with 88 students.[a] [b] As of fall 2022 the university enrolls 12,332 students from 92 countries, about 2,500 of whom live on its main campus in Newark's  University Heights district.[5][16]
